availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Fulton County, Kentucky, Episcopal minister. Chester, Delaware County, Pennsylvania native. Married to Mary F. Miller on July 31, 1838. Father of Mary L. Cowgill, John W. Cowgill, Anna L. Cowgill, Martha E. Cowgill, Louisa M. Cowgill, Nannie F. Cowgill, and Warwick M. Cowgill. P.E.C. minister in Fulton County in 1850. Owned eleven enslaved persons in 1850. Episcopal minister in Fulton County in 1860. Owned twenty-five enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fulton County. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fulton County, p. 65. Find A Grave, "Rev Nathaniel Newlin Cowgill (1810-1876)," Memorial #130602262, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/130602262# (accessed June 8, 2018).
